definition: display of severity immediately on taking office/(fig.) initial show of strength
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
power/might/prestige

sentences.english: The drill sergeant begins by putting the fear of God up every new recruit .
sentences.chinese: 这个教练军士一开始就给全体新兵一个下马威。

sentences.english: Well the main is, I think to kick the Aristotelian tradition into touch.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这主要原因是给亚里士多德传统一个下马威。

sentences.english: The drill sergeant begins by putting the fear of God into every new recruit.
sentences.chinese: 这个教练中士一开始就给全体新兵一个下马威。

sentences.english: Are you trying to psych me out ?
China challenging the US to a duel.
sentences.chinese: 这是中国对美国的一个下马威。

definition: to deliver a frontal assault/to meet head-on (idiom)
a deliberate show of strength as a warning
to look for trouble
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
lit. to kill a chicken in front of a monkey; fig. to make an example of sb (by punishment) to frighten others
peaceful measures before using force (idiom); diplomacy before violence/jaw-jaw is better than war-war
to show clearly
to gain the upper hand by a show of strength
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to play tricks on/to make a fool of
to send punitive forces against/(fig.) to criticize violently
opposite of 先禮後兵|先礼后兵[xian1 li3 hou4 bing1]
to upset the apple cart/to disrupt things
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to raise a tough question
sudden thrust (that catches the opponent off guard)
